Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw two distinctly different habitats, one on land (such as a forest) and one in water (such as a pond), with appropriate and realistic details.

The student can include a variety of clearly identified living things in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, and flowers for the land habitat, and fish, clams, and aquatic plants for the water habitat.

The student can distinguish differences in plant and animal life between the two habitats by including at least three different plants or animals in each drawing, and these differences are clearly evident.
The student can indicate patterns in their drawings, demonstrating an understanding of how certain plants and animals are typically found in specific habitats.
The student can organize the drawing in a clear manner that effectively presents the diversity of plant and animal life observed in each habitat.
CANNOT: There may be occasional minor mistakes in labeling, such as a misplacement of a label, but these do not affect the overall understanding conveyed by the drawing.
The student might inconsistently apply artistic details, perhaps omitting background details like clouds or rocks at times, although this does not detract significantly from the habitat depiction.
